info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 28 at 2:58AM EST until January 28 at 9:12PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Piedmont North Carolina including southern Mecklenburg and southeastern Gaston Counties, and Upstate South Carolina including northeastern York County. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 255 AM EST, Automated gauges indicated stream rises due to prior thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Isolated flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Uptown Charlotte, Central Charlotte, South Charlotte, Southwest Charlotte, East Charlotte, Northeast Charlotte, Northwest Charlotte, Matthews, Mint Hill, Fort Mill, Belmont, Pineville, Tega Cay, Marvin, Freedom Park, Southpark Mall, Charlotte Douglas Airport, The Arboretum, The Plaza and Carowinds. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
